title: [BUG] Prophet does not work with insample predictions
body:
**Describe the bug**
When forecasting insample predictions with prophet, an error is raised. This is due to the fact that `_get_prophet_fh` completely ignores the X passed to the predict method and produced datetime indices which are out of sample by default. 

https://github.com/sktime/sktime/blob/v0.13.4/sktime/forecasting/base/adapters/_fbprophet.py#L148

**To Reproduce**

**A complete reproducible notebook can be [found here](https://nbviewer.org/gist/ngupta23/501b7459f2f73502a766a60814b6fbf8).**

```python
from sktime.datasets import load_longley

original_data = load_longley()[1].merge(
    load_longley()[0].rename("TOTEMP"), left_index=True, right_index=True
)


from sktime.forecasting.fbprophet import Prophet

# Prophet requires to have data with a pandas.DatetimeIndex
original_data_p = original_data.to_timestamp(freq="Y")
forecaster = Prophet()
forecaster.fit(original_data_p, fh=[1, 2, 3])

# Insample
y_pred = forecaster.predict(X=original_data_p)
```

```python-traceback
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-78435a15f5d8> in <module>
      1 # Insample
----> 2 y_pred = forecaster.predict(X=original_data_p)

4 frames
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/sktime/forecasting/base/_base.py in predict(self, fh, X)
    359         else:
    360             # otherwise we call the vectorized version of predict
--> 361             y_pred = self._vectorize("predict", X=X_inner, fh=fh)
    362 
    363         # convert to output mtype, identical with last y mtype seen

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/sktime/forecasting/base/_base.py in _vectorize(self, methodname, **kwargs)
   1710 
   1711                 if methodname != "update_predict_single":
-> 1712                     y_preds += [method(X=Xs[i], **kwargs)]
   1713                 else:
   1714                     y_preds += [method(y=ys[ix], X=Xs[i], **kwargs)]

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/sktime/forecasting/base/_base.py in predict(self, fh, X)
    356         # we call the ordinary _predict if no looping/vectorization needed
    357         if not self._is_vectorized:
--> 358             y_pred = self._predict(fh=fh, X=X_inner)
    359         else:
    360             # otherwise we call the vectorized version of predict

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/sktime/forecasting/base/adapters/_fbprophet.py in _predict(self, fh, X)
    163             df["floor"] = self.growth_floor
    164 
--> 165         out = self._forecaster.predict(df)
    166 
    167         out.set_index("ds", inplace=True)

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/prophet/forecaster.py in predict(self, df, vectorized)
   1209         else:
   1210             if df.shape[0] == 0:
-> 1211                 raise ValueError('Dataframe has no rows.')
   1212             df = self.setup_dataframe(df.copy())
   1213 

ValueError: Dataframe has no rows.
```

**Expected behavior**
Prophet should be able to produce the insample predictions.

**Additional context**
Originally reported in https://github.com/pycaret/pycaret/issues/3036

**Versions**
<details>

System:
    python: 3.7.15 (default, Oct 12 2022, 19:14:55)  [GCC 7.5.0]
executable: /usr/bin/python3
   machine: Linux-5.10.133+-x86_64-with-Ubuntu-18.04-bionic

Python dependencies:
          pip: 21.1.3
   setuptools: 57.4.0
      sklearn: 1.0.2
       sktime: 0.13.4
  statsmodels: 0.12.2
        numpy: 1.21.6
        scipy: 1.7.3
       pandas: 1.3.5
   matplotlib: 3.2.2
       joblib: 1.2.0
        numba: 0.56.3
     pmdarima: None
      tsfresh: None

</details>
